medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began at birth with a dysplastic multicystic right kidney, which atrophied over time. Her height increased to >97th centile since the first months of life. At age 10, bilateral pantonal sensorineural hearing loss was diagnosed. At age 12, she exhibited long and thin fingers, camptodactyly, clinodactyly, and moderate left-convex lumbar rotoscoliosis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Dysplastic multicystic right kidney identified during pregnancy; bilateral pantonal sensorineural hearing loss diagnosed at age 10.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's father is tall with camptodactyly, hypoplasia of the left second finger, bilateral clinodactyly, and scoliosis requiring spinal surgery at age 23. He also experienced progressive bilateral pantonal sensorineural hearing loss during childhood.
